Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw plants that have enough water and light, showing them as healthy and growing.
The student can draw plants without water, showing them wilting or not growing well.
The student can draw plants without light, showing them turning yellow or not growing well.
The student can identify and label parts of the drawings to show patterns they observe (e.g., healthy vs. unhealthy plants).
The student can illustrate how plants need both water and light to thrive.
